page.title: 01Goring Area
page.content: Goring and the surrounding is underlain by chalk. There is evidence of workings in sevral disused chalk pits. The land is rolling downs,and Goring Gap is a deep valley carved out by the icy fingers of last ice age at its southern most fringe. The River Thames runs through the Gap. The Roman Icknield Way passes through the area hut no major modern roadway is included although the roads are quite heavily used. There are several wooded areas and much arable farmland, the railway also passes through the area alongside the river. Wartime evidence includes several pillboxes guarding the Thames, and a local recreation ground's gates were donated by the Belgian Air Force, as their headquarters were sited in Goring.
